api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.BusV.title: Class BusVolumePreference | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.BusV.keywords: Class BusVolumePreference Persistent volume configuration for an FMOD bus Inheritance System.Object VolumePreference BusVolumePreference Inherited Members VolumePreference.DefaultVolume VolumePreference.Initialize() VolumePreference.ClearPlayerPrefs() Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public sealed class BusVolumePreference : VolumePreference Properties BusPath Path to the bus. Notice that changing this during playtime will not reset the previous bus' volume. Declaration public string BusPath { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.String PlayerPrefsKey Declaration public override string PlayerPrefsKey { get; } Property Value Type Description System.String The PlayerPrefs key which the volume gets persisted under Overrides VolumePreference.PlayerPrefsKey Volume Declaration public override float Volume { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Single The current volume. The range goes from 0 to 1. Notice that setting this will both set the volume and persist it to PlayerPrefs. Overrides VolumePreference.Volume

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.FMOD.title: Class FMODEvent | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.FMOD.keywords: Class FMODEvent A ScriptableObject managing an FMOD event. Using this class it's possible to hook up one-shot events directly in the editor, e.g. in a UnityEvent , and across scenes. Inheritance System.Object FMODEvent Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public class FMODEvent : ScriptableObject Methods PlayOneShot() Play the FMOD event from position (0, 0, 0) Declaration public void PlayOneShot() PlayOneShot(GameObject) Play the FMOD event from a GameObject's position Declaration public void PlayOneShot(GameObject origin) Parameters Type Name Description GameObject origin Origin of the sounds PlayOneShot(MonoBehaviour) Play the FMOD event from a MonoBehavior's position Declaration public void PlayOneShot(MonoBehaviour origin) Parameters Type Name Description MonoBehaviour origin Origin of the sounds PlayOneShot(Vector3) Play the FMOD event from specific position Declaration public void PlayOneShot(Vector3 origin) Parameters Type Name Description Vector3 origin Origin of the sounds

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Focu.title: Class FocusManager | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Focu.keywords: Class FocusManager Focus manager, which suspends and resumes FMOD on unfocus and focus. Simply add this class to a GameObject in your scene. This is particularly useful for WebGL. Inheritance System.Object FocusManager Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public class FocusManager : MonoBehaviour

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.html.title: Namespace Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.html.keywords: Namespace Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Classes BusVolumePreference Persistent volume configuration for an FMOD bus FMODEvent A ScriptableObject managing an FMOD event. Using this class it's possible to hook up one-shot events directly in the editor, e.g. in a UnityEvent , and across scenes. FocusManager Focus manager, which suspends and resumes FMOD on unfocus and focus. Simply add this class to a GameObject in your scene. This is particularly useful for WebGL. VCAVolumePreference Persistent volume configuration for an FMOD VCA VolumePreference Base class for persistent volume control VolumePreferenceSlider Bind a UnityEngine.UI.Slider to a VolumePreference to make a volume slider. Add this class to the GameObject containing the Slider. WebGLInitializer Initialize FMOD properly for use with WebGL. Create an empty scene with a camera, a canvas and a button. Create a new GameObject with WebGLInitializer , or simply attach it to an existing GameObject. In the editor, configure WebGLInitializer by connecting it to the button and specifying the "real" first scene to load. (Optionally) Style and decorate the scene any way you want. Save this scene and make it the first scene in the build configuration.

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.VCAV.title: Class VCAVolumePreference | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.VCAV.keywords: Class VCAVolumePreference Persistent volume configuration for an FMOD VCA Inheritance System.Object VolumePreference VCAVolumePreference Inherited Members VolumePreference.DefaultVolume VolumePreference.Initialize() VolumePreference.ClearPlayerPrefs() Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public sealed class VCAVolumePreference : VolumePreference Properties PlayerPrefsKey Declaration public override string PlayerPrefsKey { get; } Property Value Type Description System.String The PlayerPrefs key which the volume gets persisted under Overrides VolumePreference.PlayerPrefsKey VCAPath Path to the VCA. Notice that changing this during playtime will not reset the previous VCA's volume. Declaration public string VCAPath { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.String Volume Declaration public override float Volume { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Single The current volume. The range goes from 0 to 1. Notice that setting this will both set the volume and persist it to PlayerPrefs. Overrides VolumePreference.Volume

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Volu.title: Class VolumePreference | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Volu.keywords: Class VolumePreference Base class for persistent volume control Inheritance System.Object VolumePreference BusVolumePreference VCAVolumePreference Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public abstract class VolumePreference : ScriptableObject Properties DefaultVolume Declaration public float DefaultVolume { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Single The default volume set when PlayerPrefs is empty. PlayerPrefsKey Declaration public abstract string PlayerPrefsKey { get; } Property Value Type Description System.String The PlayerPrefs key which the volume gets persisted under Volume Declaration public abstract float Volume { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Single The current volume. The range goes from 0 to 1. Notice that setting this will both set the volume and persist it to PlayerPrefs. Methods ClearPlayerPrefs() Clear the volume setting stored in PlayerPrefs. Declaration public void ClearPlayerPrefs() Initialize() Explicitly initialize the volume from PlayerPrefs. This will usually happen automatically when _initializeOnEnable is true , but you can also call this method manually for more direct control. This is e.g. useful for WebGL, where you must wait until FMOD has been properly initialized before interacting with Declaration public void Initialize()

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Volu.title: Class VolumePreferenceSlider | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.Volu.keywords: Class VolumePreferenceSlider Bind a UnityEngine.UI.Slider to a VolumePreference to make a volume slider. Add this class to the GameObject containing the Slider. Inheritance System.Object VolumePreferenceSlider Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public class VolumePreferenceSlider : MonoBehaviour Properties VolumePreference Get and set the VolumePreference to bind to. Declaration public VolumePreference VolumePreference { get; set; } Property Value Type Description VolumePreference The VolumePreference to bind to. Remarks Setting this property will update the Slider.

api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.WebG.title: Class WebGLInitializer | Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities
api/Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.WebG.keywords: Class WebGLInitializer Initialize FMOD properly for use with WebGL. Create an empty scene with a camera, a canvas and a button. Create a new GameObject with WebGLInitializer , or simply attach it to an existing GameObject. In the editor, configure WebGLInitializer by connecting it to the button and specifying the "real" first scene to load. (Optionally) Style and decorate the scene any way you want. Save this scene and make it the first scene in the build configuration. Inheritance System.Object WebGLInitializer Namespace : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities Assembly : Games.GrumpyBear.FMOD.Utilities.dll Syntax public class WebGLInitializer : MonoBehaviour Remarks This class was inspired by Fix blocked FMOD audio in Browsers and Scripting Examples | Asynchronous Loading
